publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3185# Irene Oldfather: Scotland's Industrial Museums—That the Parliament notes the work of Scotland’s industrial museums, including the Scottish Maritime Museum and the Scottish Mining Museum, in conserving our national industrial heritage across a number of communities; further notes the steps that have been taken since the publication of the Scottish Executive’s national cultural strategy to place these collections on a sustainable financial basis, and believes that these collections should be preserved for future generations. Supported by: Jackie Baillie*

S1M-3185# Irene Oldfather: Scotland's Industrial Museums—That the Parliament notes the work of Scotland’s industrial museums, including the Scottish Maritime Museum and the Scottish Mining Museum, in conserving our national industrial heritage across a number of communities; further notes the steps that have been taken since the publication of the Scottish Executive’s national cultural strategy to place these collections on a sustainable financial basis, and believes that these collections should be preserved for future generations. Supported by: Jackie Baillie, Rhona Brankin*, Karen Gillon*, Michael Russell*, Mr Michael McMahon*

S1M-3185# Scotland's Industrial Museums (lodged on 6 June 2002) Helen Eadie*, Margaret Jamieson*, Johann Lamont*, Brian Fitzpatrick*, Ms Margo MacDonald*, Andrew Wilson*, Angus MacKay*, Marilyn Livingstone*
